Name: Joha González Leal
Description:
Joha was beaten, stripped and robbed on her way to a party by a group of people who wrongly accused her of stealing a mobile phone. She died at the scene.

Joha was the youngest of two siblings and lived with her relatives in the Alma Bolivariana neighborhood. She had planned to move to Colombia the following week to work in a beauty salon with other trans women who were waiting for her.

Name: Camila Díaz Córdova ("Aurora")
Description:
Camila was killed in San Salvador after she and her friend Paola had been deported there by the US Trump Administration.

Both had sought asylum in the USA a year earlier seeking refuge from the violence and transphobia in El Salvador.

> Asociación Aspidh Arcoiris Trans, a Salvadoran trans advocacy group, told the Washington Blade that Aurora, who was also known as Camila, had been reported missing at the end of January.
> 
> The group looked for Camila at various hospitals and eventually learned she had been admitted to Rosales National Hospital in San Salvador, the Salvadoran capital, on Jan. 31 with multiple injuries. Camila passed away on Feb. 3.
> 
> She did not deserve to be killed in this way. We knew her. She was a great human being. A humble woman. the pain and the impotence of knowing what happened to her life and that they did not listen to her and that they did not believe her. All she wanted was to live hopefully that her life would change as she hoped.
> 
> Like many more of the LGBTTTI community they were killed. They are killing us. This must stop their homophobia,  transphobia and lesfobia. Jardin De Las Mariposas feels the pain of knowing that a sister was killed we will remember you when you arrived the first time and when you left you rest in peace at Aurora.

LGBT+ organisation Agencia Presentes originally reported her murder:

> LGBTI organization, Presentes, reported police in the capital San Salvador assaulted the first victim. Presentes is still investigating what led to the murder of Camila a 29-year-old sex worker.
> 
> Camila did not return to her house on 30 January and Presentes is working on two hypothesis of what happened.
> 
> One of the hypothesis is that Camila’s fellow sex workers attacked her. But a number of those sex workers told Presentes that they saw police attack Camila and dump her body several kilometers away from where she worked.
> 
> ‘Presentes has asked police for an official response but it has closed the case and has not responded,’ the organization said in a statement.
> 
> Camila’s body was found on Thursday 31 January and was taken to a nearby hospital where she died from her injuries three days later.

In July 2019 three police officers were arrested on suspicion of having participated in deprivation of liberty and aggravated homicide. In March 2020 a judge ruled that they should be sent to trial.

> The agents of the National Civil Police (PNC), Carlos Valentín Rosales Carpio, Jaime Geovany Mendoza Rivas and Luis Alfredo Avelar Sandoval, were sent to trial for the murder with aggravating circumstances of abuse of superiority againstf [deadname] Díaz, known as “ Camila".
>
> In his decision the 5th judge. of Instruction of San Salvador, said that after analyzing all the evidence, including the opinion of the forensic doctor, it has been determined that it seems likely that the defendants exercised physical violence against “Camila” since she had been the victim of multiple blows.

In July 2020 the three officers were sentenced to 20 years in prision for the crime of aggravated manslaughter.

Name: Laly Heredia Escobar ("Sonia Laly")
Description:
Laly's body was found by a neighbour lying in the street at dawn on Sunday 3rd February. She had been shot 8 times.

Her body was found outside a hotel at the intersection of Avenida Monseñor Bufano and Arribeños, Camino de Cintura. According to police she had been killed between 3am and 7am.

> She was 36 years old and had come from Lima (Peru) to Argentina 10 years earlier. She lived in Morón (province of Buenos Aires), in a house she rented with Emanuel Ferraro, a bricklayer. "We have been together for 9 years. She left home on Saturday at midnight, she had told me she was coming back at 5, but she never came. I found out what happened through the networks."
> 
> Yesterday, when the photo of Lali began to circulate on Facebook, Ferraro and one of Lali's sisters who lives in Argentina (the rest of the family lives in Lima), went to the police station and in the fourth of Los Pinos they recognized the body . 
> 
> "From what the police told me, they killed her at about 3 in the morning. She was working, when she was approached by a man asking for (sexual) services, and there she was executed in one, at the door of a hotel on Camino de Cintura. We think she died between 3 and 7 in the morning. Nobody helped her." 

Laly was one of four trans women who were killed after accusing several high-grade police officers of people trafficking.

> **Four trans girls were killed for reporting the police**
> In two months, four sex workers were killed in Camino de Cintura. Two of them had denounced police in a cause for trafficking, while the other two had suffered threats.
>
> Pamela Arancini was 40 years old, Maxim Brizuela 22, Marilin Sosa 32 and Laly Heredia 36. All were sex workers in Camino de Cintura , in La Matanza party, province of Buenos Aires . Three of them were shot while they worked and their bodies were abandoned on the road. A Marilin 's run over a year ago and died on 16 December in the Hospital of Florencio Varela. 
>
> All of them were killed along the Way. Two of them were witnesses in a cause of trafficking network where Buenos Aires police chiefs were involved and had already declared. The other two had been threatened with death for not wanting to pay the police.
>
> The case investigated by  Cecilia Incardona , in charge of the Federal Prosecutor's Office No. 2 of Lomas de Zamora, involves seven police officers, most of them high-ranking: Commissioner Inspector Nicolás Félix Breglia, Deputy Commissioner Patricio Miguel Kearny Herrera (both of Commando de Patrullas de Avellaneda), the deputy commissioner Javier Alejandro Caffarena (chief of the Llavallol branch), first lieutenant Jorge Abel Virreira and the officers César Pérez (chief of the Llavallol street), Braian Fabián Robledo (of Llavallol) and the officer main Claudia Yamila Ferrando (from Avellaneda). While Commissioner Héctor Coquena of the District Office of Ezeiza, also charged, remains fugitive.

Seven police officers were subsequently jailed, most of them high-ranking: Commissioner Inspector Nicolás Félix Breglia, Deputy Commissioner Patricio Miguel Kearny Herrera (both of the Patrol Command of Avellaneda), Deputy Commissioner Javier Alejandro Caffarena (head of the branch of Llavallol), first lieutenant Jorge Abel Virreira and the officers César Pérez (Llavallol street chief), Braian Fabián Robledo (of Llavallol) and the principal officer Claudia Yamila Ferrando (of Avellaneda). Commissioner Héctor Coquena of the District Headquarters of Ezeiza was also charged and remains a fugitive.

Name: Daniele Azevedo
Description:
Daniele went missing after leaving a hotel in the Compensa neighborhood on Monday 4th February. According to RedeTransBrasil her body was found two days later.

> Manaus / AM - The Specialized Precinct of Political and Social Order (Deops) requests the collaboration of all to locate Pedro Zidane Ferreira de Azevedo, 20, better known as "Daniele Azevedo", missing since last February 4 this year.
>
> According to her mother, Simone Ferreira, on the day she disappeared Daniele left around 6am from a hotel located on Avenida Brasil, Compensa neighborhood, west of the capital. At the time, she was in the company of friends but since then the family members have not heard from her.

Name: Mellyssa Rodrigues dos Santos
Description:
Mellyssa was beaten around the head with a piece of wood by her boyfriend after he became angry that she was still doing sex work to support herself.

Her murder took place in a building on Rua Amadeu Castanho, in the neighborhood Vila Fátima, almost at the intersection with Rua Cláudio Bere.

According to her brother they had been living together for about two months. A 27 year old man was arrested for her murder at the house of a relative. He was a fugitive from Itirapina Penitentiary having previously been sentenced to prison for murdering his aunt.

Mellyssa's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/mellyssa.rodrigues.336.

Name: Miriam Rivera
Description:
Miriam died in suspicious circumstances. She was a member of the House of Xtravaganza who appeared in Big Brother Australia and the UK TV show "There’s Something About Miriam".

> Shocking new details have surfaced about the mysterious death of transgender reality star Miriam Rivera. Miriam, who appeared on Big Brother Australia in 2004 and British dating show There’s Something About Miriam, died aged 38 in Hermosillo, Mexico on February 5.
>
> Her death wasn’t reported until this week, and Daily Mail Australia can now reveal that family members were threatened if they tried to investigate what happened.
>
> In an exclusive interview from his home in New York, Miriam’s husband Daniel Cuervo said that he suspects she met with a violent end. Mr Cuervo claimed an unknown male had called him when he was trying to arrange Miriam’s funeral and said: ‘Don’t come back to Mexico or we’ll kill you too’. He later found out her body had already been cremated, leaving no opportunity to perform an autopsy, which he found ‘very suspicious’.
>
> Because he feared for his safety, Mr Cuervo wasn’t able to arrange a proper funeral for his wife. Photos have since surfaced on Facebook of a decidedly low-key memorial service.
>
> Mr Cuervo believes his wife’s death may have been ‘passed off’ as a suicide after she refused to accept work as a prostitute for a man who was ‘infatuated’ with her. He recalled the day Miriam died: ‘On the morning of February 5, Miriam called me [in New York] from Mexico, telling me she was feeling sick and vomiting blood, so I told her to go to the hospital.
>
> ‘She called me again before leaving the hospital at 12pm and that was the last time we spoke.’. At 2pm, Miriam was found dead by hanging at her home in Hermosillo. 

In November 2021, an investigative podcast series about the series titled [Harsh Reality](https://variety.com/2021/digital/global/miriam-rivera-wondery-series-1235114091/) was released.

> Podcast studio Wondery has set up “[Harsh Reality](https://variety.com/2021/digital/global/miriam-rivera-wondery-series-1235114091/
),” a six-part investigative series on trans reality TV star Miriam Rivera’s controversial 2004 British reality dating show “There’s Something About Miriam.”
>
> The series aims to unpack the true story of the show, starring Mexican model Rivera, which aired on Sky. Set in a villa in Ibiza, the series followed six men who competed for a cash prize and for the love of Rivera. The show — produced by Remy Blumenfeld’s Brighter Pictures, which later became Remarkable under Endemol Shine U.K. — revealed she was transgender, but only in the final episode.
>
> The series is written by Agnes Borinsky and produced by Eleanor Biggs. Executive producers are Max O’Brien and Morgan M. Page for Novel and George Lavender, Marshall Lewy and Jen Sargent for Wondery. Trace Lysette, best known for her recurring role as Shea on Amazon series “Transparent,” serves as host.
>
> Lysette said: “Like many trans women from the 90s era and before, Miriam was a woman ahead of her time; a diamond in the rough that the world couldn’t appreciate in the way she deserved. I had the pleasure of knowing Miriam through NYC nightlife and the ballroom scene. She was a part of the House of Xtravaganza when I was earning my stripes in the House of Angel in the early 00’s. She was always kind to me and I feel honored to help bring this podcast about her life to the listeners. I hope she can finally be celebrated and appreciated for the pioneer that she was.”

Miriam's IMDB profile is https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1578049.

Name: Fabi Cortes Morales
Description:
Fabi was shot in the head at the Caballo Blanco bar in the municipality of Las Choapas.

According to witnesses, an unknown person entered the bar, went directly to the victim and fired twice. One of the bullets hit her in the head.

Fabi had repeatedly received threats and warnings through WhatsApp messages that circulated in Las Choapas and that they are allegedly sent by a drug cartel.

Name: Lolita
Description:
Lolita died of her injuries after a group of unidentified assailants attacked her with a machete.

> LGBTI groups have called on authorities to do something to end the violence against trans people.
> 
> ‘We demand justice from the El Salvadorian state for unpunished murders against our LGBTI populations, women and trans women,’ said Mónica Linares, the director of trans advocacy organization, Asociacion Aspidh Arcoiris Trans.
> 
> El Salvador has one of the highest murder rates in the world. Official statistics have recorded the rate of murder at 50.3 homicides per 10,000 people.
> 
> In 2017, the United Nations called for an investigation into the high murder rate of trans people in El Salavdor. Trans advocates said LGBTI people are afraid of gang violence and many flee El Salvador.
> 
> The United Nations Refugee Agency (UNHCR) even labelled the exodus of trans people from El Salvador and other Central American countries as a "refugee crisis".

Description:
Miúda's body was found inside her house in the Valverde neighborhood at dawn on Monday 11th February. She was naked and had 4 gunshot wounds.
 
> "A person so polite, helpful, did not deserve to go through it. Rest in peace, Myudinha," said a friend on a social network. Police have no details about the authorship and motivation of the crime, but said the victim was shot.

Note that her name is spelled differently in news reports and social media posts. The latter are assumed to be more likely to be correct.

Name: Giuliano Imperato
Description:
Guiliano took his own life by ingesting cyanide shortly after posting a suicide note to a Facebook Group. The previous year he had majored in law.

> A 25-year-old trans man took his own life moments after posting a profile letter on a social network. Giuliano Imperato majored in law last year. The publication, posted early Tuesday afternoon (12). In the letter Giuliano wrote an outburst that has reverberated with Facebook users since it was published.

Comments on a memorial post on the [PGM Facebook group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/pgmreal) suggest that he was in a lot of emotional pain, suffered from Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) and that his parents had disowned him after he came out.

His Facebook and Jusbrasil profiles are https://www.facebook.com/giuliano.imperato and https://imperatopink.jusbrasil.com.br/.

https://www.atribuna.com.br/cidades/santos/jovem-tira-a-pr%C3%B3pria-vida-ap%C3%B3s-publicar-carta-de-despedida-em-rede-social-1.13048

Tweet:
Guiliano Imperato took his own life in Santos, São Paulo (Brazil) on 12 Feb 2019 shortly after posting a suicide note to a Facebook Group.

He was 25, and the previous year he had majored in law. #SayHisName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Rajathi
Description:
Rajathi was a priest. Her mutilated body was found inside the sanctum of the Mariamman temple she ran. Her severed head was left outside the temple premises.

Her suspected assailants are two men who lived in the vicinity. Both are on the run.

> The main accused is identified as 23-year-old Maruthu, who owns the land on which Rajathi's temple is built. According to the police, Maruthu, along with his aide, is said to have visited the temple with a sickle when Rajathi was performing a pooja inside the sanctum on Friday morning
> 
>  Grace Banu, the founder of Trans Rights Now Collective and a native of Thoothukudi, told TNM that Maruthu and his aide then attacked her, chopped her body and placed her head outside the temple. According to sources within the trans community, the accused had been harassing Rajathi for a year.
> 
> “We heard that he used to threaten her and shout at her as the land belonged to his grandmother. She had been getting calls from him for the past one year,” Grace says.
> 
> "Maruthi and his brothers own the land where this temple is located. After the falling out, it was just Rajathi who was taking care of the temple affairs. A few days ago, Maruthu learnt that she had entered into a relationship with another man. It was following this that the bloodshed took place. Besides this, the 5 brothers also used to harass Rajathi and the trans women who came to the temple to pray. When she took over the temple, we feel they feared that the temple would fall into the hands of the trans community," the source from the community, who did not want to be named, told TNM. 

https://planettransgender.com/transgender-priest-beheaded-in-tamil-nadu/

https://www.gaystarnews.com/article/trans-priest-beheaded-india-tamil-nadu/

Rajathi was a priest. Her mutilated body was found inside the sanctum of the Mariamman temple which she had been running in Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu (India) on 15 Feb 2019.

She was 38. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Samira was stabbed twice in the armpit in a bar in northern Sorocaba. She died in hospital.

Name: Minerva Rubio
Description:
Minerva was killed by an armed group who invaded her house and shot at another person there.

> Chihuahua.- Consternation and indignation caused the second murder of a “trans” [person] in the city in less than a month, after “Minerva Rubio” was executed by a gang last Tuesday in a house in Colonia 3 de Mayo.
>
> “Minerva” was identified as [deadname] Bisinais Rubio, 26, and lost her life due to a gunshot to the head.
>
> According to initial reports, the killing took place when armed men entered and opened fire against a person who was inside a house located on calles 27th and Ninos Heroes, but it was not until yesterday morning that members of the 'trans' community from Chihuahua confirmed her death and demanded justice and the prompt investigation of the case by Prosecutor César Augusto Peniche.
>
> The murder of 'Minerva' is the second case of the year, since last January, 'Nashly', a young woman from Aldama city, who was initially reported missing since December 16, 2018, was found lifeless and in a state of decomposition in a ditch near the entrance to the city of Aldama on Wednesday, January 23.

https://www.eldiariodechihuahua.mx/local/consterna-segundo-asesinato-de-%E2%80%9Ctrans%E2%80%9D-20190221-1480539

Name: V. Barbosa de Aquino
Description:
V. was found dead in the bathroom with wounds to the stomach. There were bloodstains in various parts of the house and some possessions were missing.

> Professor [deadname] Barbosa de Aquino, 35, was found dead on Thursday morning (21) inside his own bathroom, in the southern region of Palmas. According to the Military Police (PM), the [trans person] was bloody and had a puncture in [their] belly.
>
> The crime took place in the Santa Barbara sector. Relatives of the victim said by telephone that a friend went to [deadname]'s house after they did not appear in the municipal nursery, where they worked. She found the body and called the police.
>
> The PM said that in various parts of the house there are bloodstains and that objects had been taken. Forensic experts arrived on site and the teacher's body was taken to the Forensic Medical Institute (IML), which will identify the cause of death.

https://g1.globo.com/to/tocantins/noticia/2019/02/21/professor-e-encontrado-morto-no-banheiro-da-propria-casa-em-palmas.ghtml

V. Barbosa de Aquino was stabbed in Palmas, Tocantins (Brazil) on 21 Feb 2019.

Name: Vicente Vera Párraga ("La Verito")
Description:
La Verito was stabbed 10 times in his apartment. The brutality of the murder suggested that the attack was a hate crime.

> The murder of a trans leader in Quito known as "La Verito" has shaken the LGBT movement in Ecuador. Human rights activists from that country said it was a homophobic crime.
>
> "Sources of relatives as well as friends indicated that her was brutally stabbed 10 times in his apartment, in the city of Quito," they said in the document.
>
> The organization stressed that "La Verito" fought for the recognition of the violation that the Ecuadorian State caused to the trans groups of the LGTBI community in the 80s and 90s of the last century, when they suffered repression, confinement, torture, disappearances and murders at the hands of part of the National Police.
>
> "The Ecuadorian State has so far not recognized its crimes of serious human rights violations committed against trans groups in the aforementioned decades, nor has it been concerned with recognizing and repairing them fully," he said.
>
> He also said that this situation pushed "La Verito" and his companions to convene meetings, "to seek the speed of their cases in different instances mediating the State in order to obtain justice ."
>
> The Ecuadorian LGBT movement rejected "strongly the violence that was raised against life" of the secretary of the Coccinelle collective and demanded that the State bring those responsible to justice and accelerate the processes for the recognition and reparation of the victims.

https://tn.com.ar/internacional/revelan-escabrosos-detalles-del-crimen- de-la-referente-trans-lgtb-de-ecuador-recibio-10-punaladas-en_943777

Name: Faye ("Morena Black")
Description:
Faye reportedly took her own life sometime during the weekend of 23rd/24th February.

Every loss to suicide is an absolute tragedy, and that of Faye is certainly no different. As someone who worked in the adult movie industry her personality and life has probably been subjected to far more scrutiny than most of us, and inevitably for many the person who they remember will be the media personna rather than the real person.

In Faye's case, we can only do what we can to try to balance that out - to give others a chance to remember Faye, the loving wife of Terri, rather than Morena Black, Faye's stage personna.

Faye's wife Terri was kind enough to share the following quote about her:

> "She knitted and sewed. She liked cooking Puerto Rican food to expand my horizon. We live on a dirt road in a redneck area. EVERYBODY loved us. Except our nearest neighbors, they're religious types but they never bothered us. She said Meow a lot.
> 
> "She did not like the Leftist mindset of our community and watched me get blocked and banned for not having the good sense to shut up on politics. She supported Trump and absolutely despised Kamala Harris. She filled our home with Dixie and Gadsen flags. A dixie flag is NOT racist.
> 
> "Her Twitter persona, nor her in person persona towards industry participants, was 180 degrees from the real Faye. She closed her social media,too fake, and finally quit smoking weed. She had just applied for a job at Dollar general because the manager there loved us."

https://www.xbiz.com/news/242400/report-trans-performer-morena-black-passes-away

http://groobysauce.com/uncategorized/morena-black-rest-peace.html

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-s8UUq-h5dg

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8607125/

Name: Isa
Description:
Isa was found dead in an orange grove near the hermitage of Sant Jaume de Fadrell on the outskirts of Castellón de la Plana.

She died as a result of a blow to the head and was 35-40 years old. Two people were arrested, and their trial began in December 2020.

> The two accused of strangling a trans person (with a male legal identity) on February 24, 2019 in Castellón will sit this coming Friday, December 11, on the bench of the First Section of the Provincial Court of Castellón. A jury will be in charge of judging a man and a woman who are in provisional prison, communicated and without bail for these events since last March 3, after the body of the victim was found on March 1, 2019 on the Camino Caminàs of Castellón.
>
> As highlighted in the brief made public by the Prosecutor's Office , the accused are responsible for a crime of murder, as well as another crime of robbery with violence. According to this qualification, for the male accused the prosecutor is seeking a sentence of  penalty of 25 years in prison for the crime of murder and another five more for the crime of theft typified in article 242.1 of the Penal Code. The representative of the Public Ministry requests a sentence for the accused of 20 years for the murder and 4 more years for the crime of robbery with violence.

Her killers were known to the victim.

> “The defendant and victim coexisted and even contracted life insurance for the amount of 25,000 euros in favor of his spouse, until the defendant was released and the victim learned that he had a romantic relationship with the defendant, with no criminal record computable”, reads the prosecutor's letter, who also specifies that the defendant, after returning with the victim, broke up with her and resumed his relationship with the defendant, which he took every day to a place in the capital of La Plana where she practiced prostitution.
>
> Focusing on the events that ended the life of the victim, who was 49 years old, the prosecutor reports that “knowing the existence of life insurance, the defendants acting by prior and common agreement resolved to end the life of the victim and After picking him up at the municipal shelter with the car, they arrived at the parking lot of a building where the defendant stopped the vehicle and the defendant, suddenly and unexpectedly, took the cable from an iron and placed it around the neck of the victim, beginning to squeeze it hard. Meanwhile, according to the prosecutor, the defendant started the car to avoid being discovered and the victim asked for help and continued driving until the victim stopped moving, stopping the vehicle in an orange grove in the Caminàs road area of Castellón.

In March 2021 the defendants were convicted.

> The jury which has since last Monday deliberated over the murder of a trans woman in Castelló in 2019, has unanimously declared guilty the man and woman accused of the crime. The defendants were a couple when the events occurred and the man had also had a stormy relationship with the victim, Isa.

Name: Aghata da Silva Marinho
Description:
Aghata disappeared on Wednesday 20th February. Transgender Europe (TGEU) report that her body was found 5 days later on Monday 25th February.

> The 25-year-old [trans woman] Aghata, born by name [deadname] da Silva Marinho, disappeared last night (20) in Manaus, after participating in the technical rehearsal of the Carnival samba schools in the Sambadrome, in the West Zone of the city. According to the family, she had encountered an ex-boyfriend, argued with him and been beaten. Since then the family has had no news of the young woman.
>
> Aghata's sister Luciana Marinho says family members are very worried and are trying to find information that leads to the girl's whereabouts. "She (Aghata) found an ex-boyfriend and the boy beat him. All of the family were there (at the Sambadrome), but I didn't pay attention to where she stayed. My [sister] always gets in touch with us, but so far nothing," lamented her sister.

https://www.acritica.com/channels/manaus/news/familiares-procuram-informacoes-sobre-paradeiro-de-travesti-desaparecida-em-manaus

Tweet:
Aghata da Silva Marinho disappeared on 20 Feb 2018 in Manaus, Amazonas (Brazil) on 25 Feb 2019. Reportedly her body was found 5 days later.

She was 25. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Thais
Description:
Thais and her (cisgender) boyfriend were found stabbed to death in a public toilet in Paturis Park. Both were homeless drug users.

> The trans woman was sitting on a mattress, leaning against one of the walls of the bathroom, which measures approximately 1.8 x 3.0 meters, and barefoot. Together with the bodies, a blanket, a backpack and a flashlight were also found on the floor.
> 
> The crime scene was considered "shocking" by those who had access to the scene. The amount of blood and the violence of the injuries can be indicative that more than one person could have committed the murders.
> 
> Although there is no evidence of homophobic crime, the death of a trans woman in Paturis Park refers to a story that happened more than ten years ago. Between July 2007 and August 2008, 13 homosexuals were killed on the spot. Most of the bodies were found face down, with shots at the nape of the neck, half-naked and with pants down - which is a crime of sexual intolerance.

(see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paturis_Park_murders)

She was 25. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Maxim Brizuela
Description:
Maxim was shot. She was one of four trans women who were killed after accusing several high-grade police officers of people trafficking.

> **Four trans girls were killed for reporting the police**
> In two months, four sex workers were killed in Camino de Cintura. Two of them had denounced police in a cause for trafficking, while the other two had suffered threats.
>
> Pamela Arancini was 40 years old, Maxim Brizuela 22, Marilin Sosa 32 and Laly Heredia 36. All were sex workers in Camino de Cintura , in La Matanza party, province of Buenos Aires . Three of them were shot while they worked and their bodies were abandoned on the road. A Marilin 's run over a year ago and died on 16 December in the Hospital of Florencio Varela. 
>
> All of them were killed along the Way. Two of them were witnesses in a cause of trafficking network where Buenos Aires police chiefs were involved and had already declared. The other two had been threatened with death for not wanting to pay the police.
>
> The case investigated by  Cecilia Incardona , in charge of the Federal Prosecutor's Office No. 2 of Lomas de Zamora, involves seven police officers, most of them high-ranking: Commissioner Inspector Nicolás Félix Breglia, Deputy Commissioner Patricio Miguel Kearny Herrera (both of Commando de Patrullas de Avellaneda), the deputy commissioner Javier Alejandro Caffarena (chief of the Llavallol branch), first lieutenant Jorge Abel Virreira and the officers César Pérez (chief of the Llavallol street), Braian Fabián Robledo (of Llavallol) and the officer main Claudia Yamila Ferrando (from Avellaneda). While Commissioner Héctor Coquena of the District Office of Ezeiza, also charged, remains fugitive.

Seven police officers were subsequently jailed, most of them high-ranking: Commissioner Inspector Nicolás Félix Breglia, Deputy Commissioner Patricio Miguel Kearny Herrera (both of the Patrol Command of Avellaneda), Deputy Commissioner Javier Alejandro Caffarena (head of the branch of Llavallol), first lieutenant Jorge Abel Virreira and the officers César Pérez (Llavallol street chief), Braian Fabián Robledo (of Llavallol) and the principal officer Claudia Yamila Ferrando (of Avellaneda). Commissioner Héctor Coquena of the District Headquarters of Ezeiza was also charged and remains a fugitive.
